Articles.Content: No, it will not. And I guess people should stay away from CKAN until 1.1 is out...

Just now, sarbian said:

No, it will not. And I guess people should stay away from CKAN until 1.1 is out...

Is it not possible to set the minimum version a mod is compatible with?
You will notice that the version file set the compatible version to 1.1. Something need to be done on CKAN side. I ll see what I can do but I am at work ATM...

13 minutes ago, sarbian said:

You will notice that the version file set the compatible version to 1.1. Something need to be done on CKAN side. I ll see what I can do but I am at work ATM...

I`ve mentioned it in the CKAN thread, community resource pack also wants to overwrite the 1.0.5 install with a 1.1 one so I would imagine they will do some magic on their end, AFAIK there is a min version as well as a max version attribute that can be in the .netkan file

EDIT : After going to the CKAN thread users are being advised to stay away from updating via CKAN until 1.1 drops.

Edited March 30, 2016 by John FX

8 hours ago, sarbian said:

You will notice that the version file set the compatible version to 1.1. Something need to be done on CKAN side. I ll see what I can do but I am at work ATM...

No need. the CKAN team was already working on a solution before the problem appeared for most users. It was a minor problem that Squad introduced in the last patch and now have made worse in pre-release 1.1. The Readme.txt file says version 1.0.5. CKAN checks that first to establish what version of the mod to use.

Only the games BuildID now reflects the real version that CKAN should be checking. PR already raised here https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/1645

I'm not sure how "CKAN wasn't checking build ID" is somehow a Squad issue, but I agree the readme not updating to 1.1 was a problem and it will be fixed in the next prerelease, as I mentioned on the CKAN channel.

I use & test GCMonitor-1.4.0.0 in 1.1 pre release 1174 & 1172 & i seen a problem minor one aka FPS is stuck on 25 or something, anything what it goo below that it will not report correctly, most easy to check this is Steam client > Setting > In-Game > In-Game FPS counter. I know is very possible Steam to report incorrectly to, but for sure i know in what test i do with my video card & my system game it will drop below 25

Game log are clean, no error, nothing to seen from GCMonitor mod, but if you want log i will add, no problem.
Ok here logs it sems there are some problem
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9RK2PFOUhe3ekI4di1za1l3ZHc/view?usp=sharing
Cheer & Salute

Edited April 1, 2016 by Blacks
Post Logs
hum. I changed the way I compute the FPS but I may have brought in the same bug that plague(d?) the stock FPS counter... I ll have a look, If I can manage to have ti slow down under 25fps...

to goo under 25 fps is easy :
1. EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements
2. StockVisualEnhancements v0.5.8 Ultra Resolution pack Nhawks1717
3 . Scatter
4. Take this 647 craft file (is stock craft part) https://kerbalx.com/Devthethird/Dev-Hyper-Heavy-Lifter-375t-563t

Problem solve fps it will drop
But what was make me to post log's becouse i found in them error like this:

[ERR 12:53:10.933] The AssetBundle 'file://D:\Games\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\GCMonitor\gcmonitor.ksp' can't be loaded because another AssetBundle with the same files are already loaded
you will see in logs more
Don't worry about that error. I do something in the main menu that trigger it and I did not find a way to go around it for now.

Here is 1.4.1 that fix the low FPS problem and disable the memory filling test that I had added to test KSP memory cap (the ALT K thing)

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/GCMonitor/42/artifact/GCMonitor-1.4.1.0.zip

KSP build id = 01183
GCMonitor 1.4.1.0

Confirm FPS counter problem FIX, work nominal now, noo more stack value on 25, glad you nail the problem, some small (100-400 Mb) inaccuracies as memory values but is fine

I know you was say to ignore this error but i just want to say is still there

Spoiler

[LOG 10:57:55.141] [GCMonitor] Killing Previous UI
[LOG 10:57:55.142] [GCMonitor] Asset bundles load
[LOG 10:57:55.144] [GCMonitor] True
[LOG 10:57:55.175] [GCMonitor] Asset bundles load
[LOG 10:57:55.176] [GCMonitor] True
[LOG 10:57:55.193] [GCMonitor] UIInit 1 defs
[LOG 10:57:55.194] [GCMonitor] UIInit GameObject Window
[LOG 10:57:55.194] [GCMonitor] Asset bundles Instantiate
[ERR 10:57:55.274] The AssetBundle 'file://D:\Games\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\GCMonitor\gcmonitor.ksp' can't be loaded because another AssetBundle with the same files are already loaded
[ERR 10:57:55.275] AssetLoader: Bundle is null
[LOG 10:57:55.275] [GCMonitor] UIInit 1 defs
[LOG 10:57:55.276] [GCMonitor] Null def ??

Thx for great work & small suggestion for future when you will have time & if you will can to add % of GPU & CPU usage i ask for that coz for example yesterday  i seen game it use only 50-70% GPU when it was suppose to be in full load (i use GPU-Z apps atm build by TechPowerUP) , but how i say when you will have time

Cheer & Salute
The memory is what the OS API call gives me.
Bump for 1.4.1 : https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/GCMonitor/43/artifact/GCMonitor-1.4.1.0.zip

Hey sarbian, have you considered making the display size adjustable.  It's way bigger now and it kind of blocks things from time to time.  

 

If the answer is no, then I will channel McCaunaghey and say "it be a lot cooler if you did..."

ALT+F1, hit the Config button. It would actually be a whole lot cooler if it were draggable.
